G.T.5136
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON 17th JULY, 1918.
WESTERN FRONT.
(a) French Front. The enemy continues to exert pressure astride the Marne, and has made some further progress in this direction. Elsewhere in the sector East of Reims between La Main de Massiges and La Suippe, the enemy launched five attacks last night, all of which were broken by our fire. In numerous other points in the sector East of Reins the French have advanced again to their first positions and have taken a certain number of prisoners. In the sector South-West of Reims the line runs approximately as follows:-
COULONNES - COURMAS - MARFAUX - BELVAL (enemy) - TINCOURT-MONVOISIN - (enemy) - CHENE-LA-REINE (enemy) - FESTIGNY LES-HANEAUX (French) - COMBLIZY - LA VITARDERIE (2Â½ kilometres South-East of COURTHIEZY) - FERME-DES MARECHAUX (2 kilometres north of ST AGNAN - LA-GRANGE-AUX-BOIS - LES ETANGS - CREUZANCY HALTE - thence along the railway as far as MEZY, thence no change. The German losses in the sector East of Reims are estimated at 60,000, and in the sector South-West of Reims at 40,000. So far 30 German Divisions have been identified.
(b) British Front. The hostile artillery has been active in the Somme and Ancre sectors north of the Scarpe, north-east of Bethune and north of Bailleul.
2. ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.
The situation is generally unchanged.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.I.
Issued at 12.45 p.m.
17th July, 1918.
For the personal information - of the Minister only. -
